author: cnbc.com
title: Intermolecular posts 4Q profit
text:
SAN JOSE, Calif. (AP) _ Intermolecular Inc. (IMI) on Tuesday reported fourth-quarter net income of $116,000, after reporting a loss in the same period a year earlier.
On a per-share basis, the San Jose, California-based company said it had net income of less than 1 cent. Earnings, adjusted for stock option expense, came to 1 cent per share.
The materials research company semiconductor and clean-energy industries posted revenue of $10.5 million in the period.
For the year, the company reported that its loss narrowed to $10.4 million, or 21 cents per share. Revenue was reported as $37.2 million.
For the current quarter ending in April, Intermolecular expects its results to range from a loss of 2 cents per share to a loss of 1 cent per share.
The company said it expects revenue in the range of $9.6 million to $9.9 million for the fiscal first quarter.
In the final minutes of trading on Tuesday, the company's shares hit $1.24. A year ago, they were trading at $1.15.
